inclusion.criterion: History of acute watery diarrhoea of <72 hrs.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Wt for Ht <70% of NCHS median: with or without edema.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Dark field examination positive for Vibrio cholerae.
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Consent given by the patient or legal guardian.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Data prior to beginning the study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The baseline history and examination will include: 4identification of the patient; 4a description of the symptoms prior to admission and their duration; 4detail of any treatment given for the illness before admission; 4results of physical examination including the state of hydration.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Assessment of dehydration This will be done according to the modified WHO guideline used in ICDDR,B. (Appendix-III).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Laboratory tests After admission blood for Hct, total protein, glucose, and serum electrolytes will be sent before initiation of the assigned ORS. Serum electrolytes will be repeated after 24 and 48 hours after initiation of ORS therapy. Stool sample will be sent for microscopy (including cryptosporidium and giardia) and culture for shigella, salmonella, Vibrio cholerae and ELISA for rotavirus will be done. Other relevant investigations like Total WBC count, Differential count and urine microscopy will be done routinely. Chest X-ray and/or Blood culture will be done, if necessary.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: For all blood tests 3 ml of blood will be drawn from a suitable vein in the hand.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Estimation of fecal Starch and SCFAs Feces from 50 patients will be collected in buckets. The first 24 h collected feces will be weighed and aliquot will be taken and stored at -20o C until the analysis of SCFAs by HPLC. The second and third stool samples will be collected from 24-48 h and 48-72 h respectively. The feces will be weighed and aliquot will be stored at -20oC for the determination of SCFAs.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Fecal starch will be measured enzymatically with a starch-assay kit (Total Starch Assay Procedure, Megazyme, Warriewood, Australia).
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Severe infection (e.g. severe pneumonia, clinical sepsis, meningitis).
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient is a 55yo woman with h/o ESRD on HD and peritoneal dialysis who presented with watery, non bloody diarrhea and weakness. She has a history of 2 prior C diff infections, the most recent just 1 month ago.
